group_1.narration: It began with a random chat we had in class.

group_1.textRight: Hey, Chisato!
Did your dad write this book?

group_1.narration: My classmate showed me a picture of@a book she saw on social media.@It was in fact one of my dad's books.@The author's name confirmed it.
Of course, my classmate had@no idea about the wish I'd made.@She didn't mean to upset me.

group_1.textRight: I knew it!
I heard your father was a picture book@author. So he really was then!
That's so cooooool!
The person who posted the pictures found@it by chance in Kamihama.
When was this book published?
A while ago? Right?
Oh yeah, somebody left this comment on it.
They said it's a pretty rare picture book@these days. Is it really?

group_1.narration: My dad does have a very distinct style.@So it might actually be a pretty@valuable piece of work.
But I couldn't say.

group_1.textRight: What? Why not?

group_1.narration: My dad used to be full of hope.
He drew passionately, hoping@to fill his young readers@with dreams of their own.
But that noble goal got warped and distorted@by the world around him, and by his own self.
I knew both sides of the story,@so I tried to keep a healthy distance@from the work he created.
So I really had no idea@what this book might be worth.

group_1.textRight: It's this one. Here, I'll send you the link.
By the way, don't you have a copy of it@at home?
Your dad was the author, so shouldn't he@have a whole bunch of copies?
They should be worth something, right?
So, you know...

group_1.narration: What are you trying to do?

group_1.textRight: You wanna make her sell them?
You shared the info, so now you want@something back? Am I right?

group_1.textLeft: N-no, nothing like that. No way!
I was just talking about something I saw@online...

group_1.textRight: What a lowlife...
You don't have to play nice with people@like her.
If it were me, I'd punch her right in theâ€•
Ugh, fine.

group_1.narration: Arisa is a Magical Girl, like me.
She wished to be stronger than@everyone else around her.@But before long, she was abusing her power,@and she even lost control to it.
That's when we met.
At first we were at each other's throats,@but over time we opened up@and even became friends.
After that, two girls...
Haruka Kanade and Matsuri Hinata...
They joined forces with us,@and now we make a team of four.

group_1.textRight: Are you reminiscing about your dad?

group_1.textLeft: Stop that. He isn't dead or anything.

group_1.textRight: No...but the old version of him kinda is.
Then stop doing that to yourself. It's not@something you want to remember.
You're just gonna put yourself in a funk.

group_1.narration: In fact, she was 100% correct.
Huh?@Wait a minute.

group_1.textRight: Oh come on. Stop it, right now!@It's done, over with, forgotten! Okay?
Oh? What do you mean?
